workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

head_commit.message:
VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

* EXTRA: Move Rust-in-XCode logic to rustlang.cmake

* Add Glean to the network extension target

* Initialize Glean on the network extension

* Make iOS tunnel message handling more robust

+ Create a telemetryEnabled message type

* DETOUR: Create singleton to manage iOS tunnel

* Sync telemetry enabled value with iOS Network Extension

* Update Glean to v53.0.0

* Shutdown Glean on tunnel destruction

This is added to the iOs network extension but not the Android
daemon, because the network extension process is immediatelly
killed when the VPN is turned off. If we want to send a ping
on deactivation it doesn't get persisted unless we wait for
the Glean dispatcher.'

* Address location issue

head_commit.message:
Bug 1774273 - Part (1/2) - Add signingscript macos notarization task (#7044)

MacOS notarization is moving from iscript to signingscript and requires a separate task.

There are no ways of testing notarization outside production. So, this change only adds the notarization task, but DOES NOT affect any other tasks.
The current signing still notarizes, and is treated as source/upstream by the beetmover task

head_commit.message: Add some unit test coverage for connection health (#6948)

Restore qtglean/Cargo.lock (#7026)

Cargo.lock files are required so that a given version of Mozilla VPN
can be rebuilt from the same code.

The NixOS package cannot be built without Cargo.lock, because NixOS
enforces this kind of determinism using a sandbox that disables
network access for builds that don’t have a fixed output hash.

This undoes #6278.  See also #3341, #5236.

Signed-off-by: Anders Kaseorg <andersk@mit.edu>

workflow_runs.display_title: ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

head_commit.message:
ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

This check neglects to take into account the fact that there are two
products being beetmoved. Addons and the client. E.g, when the
shipping-phase is `promote-addons`, the client tasks will have no
destination paths, and that is totally valid.

* Use a versioned URL for win-rustup fetch task.

workflow_runs.display_title: Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph re…

head_commit.message:
Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph related files (#6774)

Releng acts as CODEOWNERS for these files in many other projects as
well. This way we can help nudge projects towards standardized ways of
doing things which brings benefits to everyone!

Note that we typically review for best practices / security, but don't
want to add friction or get involved in the minor details of a CI
pipeline. So in most cases, it would be good to get a review from
someone on the VPN team as well.

workflow_runs.name: Translations
workflow_runs.display_title: Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

head_commit.message:
Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

Paths like //usr/lib/mozillavpn/mozillavpnnp may cause Firefox to not
find the mozillavpnnp binary

Currently uses disagree on whether it is meant to be absolute or relative to /

From linux/mozillavpn.spec:
%cmake -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/usr/lib -DCMAKE_INSTALL_SYSCONFDIR=/etc -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

From linux/debian/rules:
	dh_auto_configure -- -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/lib -DBUILD_ID=$(DEB_VERSION) -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

Use an absolute path be default for WEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR, as it is
easier when variables point to install dirs in build processes, i.e.
/${lib} is easier than stripping a leading / from %{_libdir}.
